channel.title: Portfolio on David Farrell
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolio on David Farrell

item.title: LifeLab+
item.description: LifeLab+ was my largest and highest profile project for GCU.

item.title: Game Design Consultancy
item.description: I like to keep my hand in with professional game design and I offer private game consultancy to development studios.

item.title: SUSFANS
item.description: My client Wageningen was faced with a difficult technical challenge. They had undertaken a significant simulation and modelling exercise on the future of European food security for the European Union and were committed to finding a way to present their data using novel data visualisation techniques.

item.title: Enchanted Crystals
item.description: I was the lead on this project that aimed to improve the mental maths skills of pupils across Europe.

item.title: Game-Based Learning for Teachers
item.description: Most books about game based learning are aimed at academics. I love (many of) these books and they have greatly informed my practice as a designer of such games.

item.title: Gaming Climate Futures
item.description: Purdue University invited me to join as a consultant on a simulated climate negotiation exprerience for United Nations decision makers.

item.title: BBC Digital Cities
item.description: Working with an ex-BBC colleague, I helped to organise a one day B2B conference for the BBC Digital Cities programme.

item.title: Global Game Jam
item.description: For most of the last decade, I’ve been the main organiser of the Glasgow venue of the Global Game Jam.

item.title: #GamesInsight
item.description: For the last several years, I’ve organised a series of high profile invited talks in Glasgow.

item.title: Brand Bang!
item.description: I designed and developed a Faceboook and iPad game that would perform market research whilst people played.

item.title: Super Microbe World
item.description: I was the Serious Games expert, programmer, and game designer on this project.

item.title: The Microbe Files
item.description: I was the Serious Games expert, programmer, and game designer / writer on this project.

item.title: Evil Machines
item.description: I have a soft spot for this game. This was the first real game I ever developed.
